examples.translation: Water is leaking through the ceiling.

glosses: (for a secret) to leak out, become known

examples.translation: The FBI infiltrated into the terrorist organization.

glosses: to fall asleep, pass out (after getting drunk)

examples.translation: Don't drink too much, otherwise you will pass out.

etymology:
From Ottoman Turkish صیزمق (sızmak, “to ooze through a vessel, to trickle, leak out, pass out”), from Proto-Turkic *sïŕ- (“to ooze, to melt”).
Cognates
Cognate with Karakhanid [script needed] (sızmāk, “to drip, melt, lose weight”), Azerbaijani sızmaq (“to leak”), Chagatai [script needed] (sızmak, “to drip, ooze”), Chuvash шӑранма (šăranma, “to melt, lose weight”), Kipchak [Arabic needed] (sız-, “to melt”), Kyrgyz сызуу (sızuu, “to ooze, trickle”), Southern Altai сызар (sïzar, “to ooze”),
Tatar сызу (sızu, “to melt”), Turkmen syzmak (“to ooze”), Tuvan сыскаар (sıskaar, “to strain, filter”), Uzbek sizmoq (“to ooze”).
